column4: Australian Apple users report 'lost phone' cyber attack
column5: SAN FRANCISCO/SYDNEY Multiple users on Apple Inc's online support forum and Twitter have reported an unusual smartphone and tablet hack in which cyber attackers were said to have locked Australian users' smartphones and demanded payment in return for unlocking them.

column4: Australian Apple users report "lost phone" cyber attack
column5: SAN FRANCISCO/SYDNEY  May 28 Multiple users on Apple Inc's online support forum and Twitter have reported an unusual smartphone and tablet hack in which cyber attackers were said to have locked Australian users' smartphones and demanded payment in return for unlocking them.

column4: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
column5: (Adds Stryker  Vivus  Transcontinental  Orange  St. Jude Medical; Updates Weir  Valeant  General Electric)

column4: Valeant injects cash into bid for Botox maker Allergan
column5: Canada's Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc   raised the cash component of its unsolicited offer for Botox maker Allergan Inc  on Wednesday  but the increased bid fell short of expectations and both stocks dropped.

column4: UPDATE 4-Valeant injects cash into bid for Botox maker Allergan
column5: May 28 Canada's Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  raised the cash component of its unsolicited offer for Botox maker Allergan Inc on Wednesday  but the increased bid fell short of expectations and both stocks dropped.

column4: Nestle boosts skincare business with $1.4 billion Valeant deal
column5: LONDON/ZURICH Swiss food group Nestle accelerated a push into the fast-growing skincare market on Wednesday  buying the rights to several injectable treatments for facial wrinkles and lines from Valeant Pharmaceuticals International for $1.4 billion. | Video

column4: UPDATE 3-Nestle boosts skincare business with $1.4 bln Valeant deal
column5: * Valeant says deal clears way for it to buy Allergan   (Adds more analyst comments  background)

column4: CANADA STOCKS-Valeant leads decline as TSX hits one-week low
column5: * TSX falls 91.73 points  or 0.63 percent  to 14 566.29     * Nine of the 10 main index sectors decline     * Valeant drops 3.6 percent after raising Allergan bid      By John Tilak     TORONTO  May 28 Canada's main stock index fell to its lowest in a week on Wednesday  hit by a decline in shares of Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc after the drugmaker raised its takeover offer for Allergan Inc.     Valeant's stock gave back 3 percent after the company increased the cash comp

column4: Valeant increases bid for Botox-maker Allergan
column5: May 28 Canadian drugmaker Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc raised the cash component of its offer for Botox-maker Allergan Inc by $10 per share.

column4: Nestle moves into medical skin treatments with new firm
column5: ZURICH  May 28 Nestle SA said on Wednesday it was branching into medical skin treatments and had acquired the rights to several skin products from Canadian firm Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc for $1.4 billion in cash.

column4: Waddell & Reed to exit Sands China with $1.3 billion selldown: term sheet
column5: HONG KONG U.S. investment firm Waddell & Reed Financial Inc.  launched on Wednesday an up to $1.3 billion selldown in Sands China Ltd.   offering its remaining stake in the casino operator  according to a term sheet of the deal seen by Reuters.

column4: Waddell & Reed to exit Sands China with $1.3 bln selldown-term sheet
column5: HONG KONG  May 28 U.S. investment firm Waddell & Reed Financial Inc. launched on Wednesday an up to $1.3 billion selldown in Sands China Ltd.  offering its remaining stake in the casino operator  according to a term sheet of the deal seen by Reuters.

column4: Fitch Rates Disney's Proposed Offering 'A'
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  May 28 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned an 'A' rating to The Walt  Disney Company's (Disney) proposed offering of benchmark-sized three-  five-   and 30-year senior unsecured notes.  The Rating Outlook is Stable. Approximately  $15.6 billion of debt was outstanding as of March 31  2014. A full list of  ratings follows at the end of this release. Proceeds will be used for general corporate purposes including repayment of debt

column4: Westlake Chemical to buy German rival for about $667 mln
column5: May 28 Petrochemicals company Westlake Chemical Corp said it would buy Germany polyvinyl chloride (PVC) maker Vinnolit Holdings GmbH and its subsidiary companies for 490 million euros ($667 million) from private-equity firm Advent International.
